item.title: Arduino IDE build process explained (in details)
item.author: embeddedk8
item.description: From the user’s perspective, building an Arduino sketch with the Arduino IDE seems as simple as clicking one button. But under the hood, the IDE performs several important steps: some are common to every embedded development environment, while others are unique to Arduino — and might surprise you if you’re new to it. In this post, we’ll take a closer look at what actually happens when the Arduino IDE builds your sketch, and why understanding this process can help you move toward more advanced embedded development.
